intro: Andromeda ciliicalyx, commonly known as the silky andromeda, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of southeastern Asia. It belongs to the Ericaceae family, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and clusters of small, bell-shaped flowers. The plant produces showy pink to white blooms in the spring, which attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically leathery and have a fine, silken hair covering the undersides, contributing to its common name. The plant thrives in acidic, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded, moist forest environments.
